SEARCH
Package thirdparty.net.oelen.polsolve.pzeros

Class Convex

java.lang.Object
thirdparty.net.oelen.polsolve.pzeros.Convex
class Convex extends Object
CLASS CONVEX * Compute the upper convex hull of the set (i,a(i)), i.e., the set of * vertices (i_k,a(i_k)), k=1,2,...,m, such that the points (i,a(i)) lie * below the straight lines passing through two consecutive vertices. * The abscissae of the vertices of the convex hull equal the indices of * the TRUE components of the logical output vector H. * The used method requires O(nlog n) comparisons and is based on a * divide-and-conquer technique. Once the upper convex hull of two * contiguous sets (say, {(1,a(1)),(2,a(2)),...,(k,a(k))} and * {(k,a(k)), (k+1,a(k+1)),...,(q,a(q))}) have been computed, then * the upper convex hull of their union is provided by the subroutine * CMERGE. The program starts with sets made up by two consecutive * points, which trivially constitute a convex hull, then obtains sets * of 3,5,9... points, up to arrive at the entire set. * The program uses the subroutine CMERGE; the subroutine CMERGE uses * the subroutines LEFT, RIGHT and CTEST. The latter tests the convexity * of the angle formed by the points (i,a(i)), (j,a(j)), (k,a(k)) in the * vertex (j,a(j)) up to within a given tolerance TOLER, where iinvalid input: '<'jinvalid input: '<'k. *

      static void cnvex(int n, double[] a, boolean[] h)
      SUBROUTINE CNVEX * ************************************************************* Compute the convex hull of the data set a[]. The result * is in the bool vector h[]. The algorithm successively * merges adjacent convex hulls of sizes 2, 4, 8, ... *
